page.title: 12POLICEMAN IN HUNTINGDON.
page.content: When we interviewed P.C.Woods he told us that he has three shifts.Mornings, from O6:OO to 14:OO, afternoons from 14:OO _ 22:OO and nights 22:OO to O6:OO.If the force are busy they are asked to work 12 hour shifts.The first thing he does is to listen to the chief Constable who instructs the constables about what has been happening, what to look for, and their daily task.The men then go out and either walk around the streets or drive the panda cars.P.C Woods summarised his job as helping the public, protecting life and looking after peoples property.He said the main aim of the police was to prevent crime.Much of his day was spent in the local area dealing with complaints about other people and accidents.
